recipes.notes: The provided HTML appears to be truncated at the main content area. The page shows navigation and header structure but lacks visible search result items. This is a 404 error page (error404 body class) displaying homepage content. No actual search results are present. Page uses Newspaper theme (WordPress TD Composer). Standard result container is .td_module_wrap with nested title in .entry-title a. Snippet would be in .td_excerpt if present. Date in .td-module-date. Actual search results not shown in provided HTML (truncated), but structure inferred from theme CSS classes and JavaScript variables referencing 'Newspaper' theme v12.6.8.

Blogger search results page with standard Blogger post structure. Results are wrapped in div.post-outer containers within div.blog-posts. Each post has a title (h3.post-title.entry-title), link within the title, content body (div.post-body.entry-content), and timestamp (abbr.published). Date header (h2.date-header) groups posts by date.

The page structure shows article containers with class 'article' containing nested divs. Each result has a title link, snippet text, and date stamp. The search appears to use the same template as category/archive pages. The 'talinks' div contains additional result items with thumbnails and dates. Results follow a pattern of div.proto and div.talinks sections within div.article containers.

Page returns 404 'Page Not Found' with no results displayed. Selectors inferred from Newspaper theme (td-composer) structure commonly used on pecsma.hu. The theme uses 'td-post-item' class for article containers and 'td-post-title' for titles. Actual result items would be wrapped in article or div.td-post-item elements if search returned results. Date selectors based on typical Newspaper theme implementation.

This is a 404/no results page for search query 'srl'. Current page shows 404 error with no search results. Based on page structure, results would likely appear in div.world-news containers within div.posts, with titles in a.title elements. The site uses a newspaper layout with div.col-md-9.total-news as main content area. Date selectors not visible in page structure. Page uses K2 component (Joomla extension) for content management. HTML is truncated and shows navigation/header structure but actual search results content is not visible in provided excerpt. Based on K2 framework conventions, article containers would use k2-item classes, titles would be in h2/h3 with k2-item-title class, and snippets would be in k2-item-excerpt or k2-item-introtext divs. Date information typically appears in span.k2-item-date. These selectors are inferred from K2 component standard markup patterns.

Current page shows 'Pagina non trovata' (Page not found) for query 'srl'. HTML structure inferred from WordPress theme patterns and common search result markup. This appears to be a homepage rather than a dedicated search results page. The URL contains ?s=srl query parameter but returns homepage content. The structure suggests results would follow this pattern: article container with image link, span.navigazione (date), h1 (title link), h2 (snippet). Search results may display similarly when actual search matches exist.
